007 * All rights reserved. Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.util.bits;
010
011/**
012 * This interface defines the behavior of bit vectors, i.e.,
013 * fixed-sized vectors with single bit elements.
014 * This is similar to the standard Java class {@link java.util.BitSet}, which
015 * implements variable-sized vectors and additional functionality.
016 * 
017 * @author WB
018 */
019public interface BitVector {
020        
021        /**
022         * Returns {@code true} is the specified bit-element is set (1),
023         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
024         * @param i the element index
025         * @return as described
026         */
027        public boolean get(int i);
028        
029        /**
030         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
031         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
032         * @param i the element index
033         * @param val a boolean value
034         */
035        public default void set(int i, boolean val) {
036                if (val) 
037                        this.set(i);
038                else
039                        this.unset(i);
040        }
041        
042        /**
043         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
044         * @param i the element index
045         */
046        public void set(int i);
047        
048        /**
049         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
050         * @param i the element index
051         */
052        public void unset(int i);
053        
054        /**
055         * Sets all element values to 1.
056         */
057        public void setAll();
058        
059        /**
060         * Sets all element values to 0.
061         */
062        public void unsetAll();
063        
064        /**
065         * Returns the length of this bit vector.
066         * @return the length of this bit vector
067         */
068        public int getLength();
069        
070        /**
071         * Returns the contents of this bit vector as a {@code byte} array.
072         * Bit-value 0 maps to byte value 0, value 1 maps to 1.
073         * @return a {@code byte} array
074         */
075        public default byte[] toByteArray() {
076                byte[] bytes = new byte[this.getLength()];
077                for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
078                        if (get(i)) {
079                                bytes[i] = 1;
080                        }
081                }
082                return bytes;
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Returns the contents of this bit vector as a {@code boolean} array.
087         * Bit-value 0 maps to false, value 1 maps to true.
088         * @return a {@code boolean} array
089         */
090        public default boolean[] toBooleanArray() {
091                boolean[] bools = new boolean[this.getLength()];
092                for (int i = 0; i < bools.length; i++) {
093                        bools[i] = get(i);
094                }
095                return bools;
096        }
097        
098        // static factory methods -----------------------------------------------
099        
100        /**
101         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
102         * {@link BitVector64} from the specified {@code byte}
103         * array. Each byte element b is interpreted as 0/false
104         * if b = 0 and 1/true otherwise.
105         * 
106         * @param bytes an array of byte values
107         * @return a new bit vector
108         */
109        public static BitVector from(byte[] bytes) {
110                return new BitVector64(bytes);
111        }
112        
113        /**
114         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
115         * {@link BitVector64} from the specified {@code boolean}
116         * array, setting elements to 0/false or 1/true.
117         * 
118         * @param bools an array of boolean values
119         * @return a new bit vector
120         */
121        public static BitVector from(boolean[] bools) {
122                return new BitVector64(bools);
123        }
124        
125        /**
126         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
127         * {@link BitVector64} with the specified length.
128         * Elements are initialized to 0/false.
129         * 
130         * @param length the length of the bit vector
131         * @return a new bit vector
132         */
133        public static BitVector create(int length) {
134                return new BitVector64(length);
135        }
136        
137        /**
138         * Binarizes the specified {@code byte[]} by replacing
139         * all non-zero values by 1.
140         * Returns a new array, the original array is not modified.
141         * 
142         * @param b a {@code byte[]}
143         * @return a new {@code byte[]} with values 0/1 only
144         */
145        public static byte[] binarize(byte[] b) {
146                byte[] b2 = b.clone();
147                for (int i = 0; i < b2.length; i++) {
148                        if (b2[i] != 0) {
149                                b2[i] = 1;
150                        }
151                }
152                return b2;
153        }
154
155}
